Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed streaky black (fired dark brown) below; traces of added white bands; exterior: reserved with black line at top of rim; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0278) (phase 2)
